verses.verse: A Penitent Sufferer’s Plea for Healing A Psalm of David, for the memorial offering. (Ps 6.1) O LORD, do not rebuke me in your anger or discipline me in your wrath.
(Job 6.4; Ps 32.4) For your arrows have sunk into me, and your hand has come down on me.
(Ps 6.2; Isa 1.6) There is no soundness in my flesh because of your indignation; there is no health in my bones because of my sin.
(Ezra 9.6) For my iniquities have gone over my head; they weigh like a burden too heavy for me.
(Ps 69.5) My wounds grow foul and fester because of my foolishness;
(Ps 35.14; 42.9) I am utterly bowed down and prostrate; all day long I go around mourning.
(v 3|PSA 38:3; Ps 102.3) For my loins are filled with burning, and there is no soundness in my flesh.
(Job 3.24; Ps 22.1) I am utterly spent and crushed; I groan because of the tumult of my heart.
(Ps 6.6; 10.17) O Lord, all my longing is known to you; my sighing is not hidden from you.
My heart throbs; my strength fails me; as for the light of my eyes—it also has gone from me.
(Ps 31.11; Lk 23.49) My friends and companions stand aloof from my affliction, and my neighbors stand far off.
(Ps 35.4, 20; 54.3; 140.5) Those who seek my life lay their snares; those who seek to hurt me speak of ruin and meditate on treachery all day long.
(Ps 39.2, 9) But I am like the deaf; I do not hear; like the mute, who cannot speak.
Truly, I am like one who does not hear and in whose mouth is no retort.
(Ps 17.6; 39.7) But it is for you, O LORD, that I wait; it is you, O Lord my God, who will answer.
(Ps 13.4; 35.26) For I pray, “Only do not let them rejoice over me, those who boast against me when my foot slips.”
(Ps 13.2) For I am ready to fall, and my pain is ever with me.
(Ps 32.5; 2 Cor 7.9) I confess my iniquity; I am sorry for my sin.
(Ps 18.17; 35.19) Those who are my foes without cause (Q ms: MT my living foes) are mighty, and many are those who hate me wrongfully.
(Ps 35.12; 1 Jn 3.12) Those who render me evil for good are my adversaries because I follow after good.
(Ps 35.22) Do not forsake me, O LORD; O my God, do not be far from me;
(Ps 27.1; 40.13, 17) make haste to help me, O Lord, my salvation.
